授業目的:
1. To get an overview of Japan's history until 1640.
2. To learn how to work with sources.
3. To polish the academic skills of the participants.
到達目標:
1. Participants has a grasp of Japan's history until 1640. They can identify important events and persons, and explain the historical contexts, as well as discuss how the importance of those particular details is argued.
2. Participants can analyze a source [in translation] and contextualize it in the framework of history studied in class.
3. Participants can produce an academic discussion of an academic article on a subject related to the course topic.
特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（歴史Ａ）（CIEC）/Japanese History A（国際学部）
授業方法: Lectures based on discussions of the textbook, analyses of source materials and selected academic articles.  Taking turns students will be responsible for starting off the discussion of the textbook.  Online tests will keep you on track of your studies.  Regularly, but not in every class, participants must submit answers, questions and comments related to material discussed in class.

第1回:
9/25 Introduction: a general overview of the period we will cover. Practical information.
First source analysis exercise.
Get the textbook and familiarize yourself with it. The first chapter is available on LUNA.
第2回:
10/2 Japan before 600 Read chapter 1.
What is the structure of the chapter, and what are its learning points?
Short comprehension test on LUNA, to be taken in Class.
Read chapter 1 for this class. Make a scheme of the learning points in the chapter. This should help you answer the questions in the quiz.
第3回: 10/9 Taika and Nara Chapter 2 "An end to growth, 600-800"
第4回: 10/16 Nara age Japan. Discussions based on two academic articles.
第6回: Deadline for report on Heian literature.
第7回:
Read Chapter 4. 
Assignment of a 5 to 6-page report (Deadline: Class 11).
第8回: 11/13 Kamakura: Economics and Political Tensions in an Epoch of Minimal Growth.
第14回: 1/8 Shorter exam: includes questions given in the online quizzes and a brief report on a source.
